summary: The Abandoned Well Remediation Research and Development Act amends the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act to establish a research program focused on abandoned oil and gas wells. The program aims to improve data collection, plugging, remediation, reclamation, and repurposing of these wells. It will also study strategies to mitigate environmental impacts and understand the effects on groundwater. The Secretary of Energy, in coordination with relevant agencies and entities, is responsible for the program, which will involve research and development activities and has specified authorized appropriations for several fiscal years.
